page.title: 10Windsurfing in Mumbles
page.content: Windsurfing locally began in 1981. In 1981 only 2 or 3 boards would be seen on Mumbles Bay. Then shops began to sell equipment in Mumbles like Dave Friar's and Island Style.The newest one is called Sailsports. In 1984 the Division 2 National Championships were held on Mumbles Bay. It was held on Mumbles Bay because it has flat water.Also in 1984 there was a sponsored windsurf by R.Lewis from Ilfracombe to Mumbles which raised Â£1,825 for Mumbles lifeboat and took 2 hours 40 minutes. Later on this year there will be a long distance race around Swansea Bay. Next year will be the Division 1 Championships.They will be held in Mumbles. You can get a second hand board for about Â£150 but bought from a shop they could cost up to Â£1,000. By Bithika Mookherjee.
